overview_of_class: Introduction to Physical Geology: The study of Earth materials and the physical, chemical and biological processes that shape the planet. Topics include minerals; sedimentary, igneous, and metamorphic rocks; the interior Earth, oceans, and atmosphere; solid Earth processes, such as volcanism, seismicity, and plate tectonics and their interactions with the atmosphere and hydrosphere to drive surface Earth processes, such as climate, weathering, and glaciation; geologic time; global change. Course includes mandatory field trip to Baraboo, WI. (The field trip to Baraboo, Wisconsin will take place May 20-22, 2016.)
name: Earth Systems Revealed
subject: EARTH
